text: [Music]
Madame assuming I am the engineering
manager of infrastructure lamb-lamb is a
company about urban transportation we
provide a green and affordable
transportation option for the users our
scooter is connected to our servers to
ensure higher quality of service we need
to send commands to scooter in almost
real-time maintaining hundreds of
thousands concurrent connection is a
huge engineering challenge and then
number is only growing so we collect all
kind of information between these
vehicles for example GPS location
velocity battery level motor information
safety is a top priority for line for
example we have a feature that requires
us to slow down vehicle when it entered
a certain areas of the city to achieve
that we have to increase the frequency
of data collection drastically we have a
team of data scientists and machine
learning engineers the team analyzes
useless data of our product and help us
understand how people use our service so
for the normal usage we see the spikes
from like 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.
depending on where you are but sometimes
we also notice a very interesting spike
at 9:00 p.m. so we have a network of
on-demand workers that charge our
scooters we call them juicers every
night 9:00 p.m. we start to allow true
so to collect scooters all of them open
the app at the same time so the traffic
flat into a server and caused a traffic
spike in the past the traffic come
directly into a relational database our
service become slower and unusable we
started to use Amazon Kinesis to ingest
real-time data coming from our vehicles
the speeds up of the growth of this
industry is incredible scalability is
one critical issue we have to deal with
we can let Kinesis do the heavy lifting
behind the scene we can spend the term
to work on some more important feature
that user really needs
